message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) because it focuses on semantic textual similarity and evaluations on word-level and sentence-level semantic textual similarity benchmarks. It could also belong to the sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG) because it discusses the use of embeddings and similarity measures. Additionally, it could be classified under Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) because it deals with natural language processing and similarity measures. Information Retrieval (cs.IR) is another possible sub-category because the paper discusses the evaluation of similarity measures on benchmarks. Finally, Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) is a possible sub-category because the paper mentions deep representations.
